Comerica Inc	Job Description

Interactive Teller Machines Agent The Interactive Teller Machine Agent (ITM Agent) role is to communicate with the Banking Center customers from all markets via ITMs and perform teller transactions accurately and efficiently in accordance with CSR policies and procedures. When not assisting banking center customers

Position CompetenciesSuccessful incumbents possess strong communication skills; customer relations skills to interact effectively with irate or angry customers regarding service and procedures; decision making skills when contacting customers to discuss or resolve problems; judgement skills and solicits new business skills from pertinent information gathered from customers to clarify their inquiry or complaint.
Position Responsibilities:
Service
Analyze and resolve problems quickly
Provide remarkable customer service
Communicate face-to-face with banking center customers from all markets
Be knowledgeable of consumer products and services; referring loan and deposit products to consumer and small business customers.
Compliance
Ensure compliance with applicable federal
Control losses by following banking center transaction policy and procedures.
Adhere to all Retail Bank audit and compliance standards.
Operations
Troubleshoot and resolve video teller banking and online mobile banking issues with emphasis on customer service.
Work with emerging technologies including multiple systems required to perform routine job functions.
Teamwork
Interact with banking centers
Interact with Retail Support Center (Teller) as well as Project Management teams.
Collaborate with internal departments ensuring major technical support issues are addressed.
Assist in developing communications and knowledge database for internal customers.
RelocationRelocation assistance is not provided for this position.
TravelTravel is not required for this position.
Qualifications
High School Diploma or the equivalent (GED)
2 years of CSR experience OR 1 year of technical help desk experience
3 years of customer service experience
3 years of personal computer
1 year of sales experience
Work Schedule
6:00pm - 11:15pm Monday - Wednesday / 4:00pm - 8:15pm Saturday / Off Thursday and Friday
Work Location(s)
Auburn Hills Technical Center

Comerica Dealer Floor Plan AuditorThe Comerica Dealer Floor Plan Auditor role will perform floor plan audits which evaluate the collateral of new auto floorplan loans to assist in preventing losses. This role will perform timely audits of dealership inventory and related dealership records and keep National Dealer Commercial Services management properly informed. It will also work in remote locations away from both Dallas - based management and immediate supervision.
Primary LocationThe Dealer Floor Plan Auditor position is officially located in Raleigh
Job Title: but will generally involve an alternative/home-office work arrangement and will report to the Dealer Floor Plan Manager. This position has no direct reports.

Bank Name: Position Responsibilities:* Prepare management reports.* Perform physical inspection of the Bank's vehicle collateral; noting condition
Job Title: cash receipt and finance information needed to analyze the customer's compliance regarding the Bank's loan policy.* Reconciliation of inventory which is not seen or identified as sold and noting its likely location based on the dealership's internal documentation.* Reconcile Dealer exceptions appearing on the audit listing to assist the customer and Dealer Operations.* Observe the overall condition of the dealership operation and report to management any unusual items or areas of concern.* Serve as primary liaison between the Bank and the customer. Provide quality customer service while interacting with the owners and operators of the auto dealerships.* Generate computer reports detailing audit results which are distributed to management and serve as the basis for credit decisions.* Review and educate Dealer personnel on Bank audit reports and other Bank generated documents that can be used as a tool for the customer.* Schedule and coordinate multiple concurrent audits while traveling extensively and complying with credit policy frequency standards. Ability to make changes at a moment's notice to better serve Loan Group.* On-going communication with Loan Group and Credit Administration. Training new lenders on the overall floor plan audit product.* Consult with the Loan Group regarding irregular audit results
URL (URL of the job posting): changes in Dealer management and maintain on-going communication for high risk audits. Assist in the investigation and management of problem credits. Participate in special projects and requests by the Loan Group.* Assist with training of new Dealer Audit employees.* Assist Floorplan manager and ADFA manager with lease audits.

Bank Name: TravelUp to 50% Travel is required for this position.
RelocationRelocation assistance is not available.
Qualifications

*?High school diploma or the equivalent (GED) with experience OR Associate degree* 2 years of experience in banking or financial services industry* 1 year of inventory auditing/management experience* 1 year of auto industry experience* 1 of experience utilizing Microsoft Office Products including Word
Work Schedule
8:00 am - 5:00 pm Monday - Friday

Work From Home NC

Comerica Inc	Job Description
Trust Estate Officer IV

The Trust Estate Officer IV serves as a relationship manager to larger and more complex relationships providing comprehensive wealth management advice and counsel on a broad array of wealth planning issues. This position will act as the fiduciary resource for a specific area of account administration and will ensure proper management and administration for a large variety of assigned accounts adhering to applicable laws and regulations as well as complying with all requisite policies and procedures. Position will act as the intermediary to the organization on behalf of clients and coordinate service activities with other areas of the organization. The position's direct involvement in business development is expected to contribute to the achievement of the annual net new business goal for the division.
Position Competencies
Successful incumbents possess integrity and trust
Job Title: listening skills

Bank Name: Position Responsibilities
Manages the larger and more complex accounts in accordance with the terms of the various governing documents
Job Title: and consistent with the needs of the principals and income beneficiaries.

Bank Name: Reviews
Job Title: monitors and reviews account transactions
URL (URL of the job posting): responds to incoming correspondence and any other client requests to ensure compliance with the governing document

Job Title: 3) obtaining an executed Investment Policy Statement
URL (URL of the job posting): and 4) participate in the review of an investment proposal

Bank Name: Responds to client inquiries and coordinates the implementation and review of investment programs
Independently resolves most issues brought forth by principals
Job Title: and remainder men such as requests for special distributions

Bank Name: Oversees the opening and closing of accounts
Job Title: ensures the full and complete transfer of assets

Bank Name: Oversees tax reporting activities
Oftentimes manages large family relationships and multigenerational trusts
Provides comprehensive wealth planning advice to clients
Discusses tax strategies
Job Title: and wealth transfer strategies.

Bank Name: Coordinates the delivery of services with other professionals assigned to the client team or from within the organization
Coordinates with client's other advisors
Develops new business through referrals from external and internal centers of influence and/or through expansion of business within current book of clients.
Attends meetings and external presentations with referral sources to encourage business exchange.
Consults with team members on the development of strategies and proposals for closing new business.
Stays current on fiduciary/tax/legal changes that effect a client's wealth plan or administration of accounts.
Participates in projects which affect the broader business and improves efficiency of delivery of services to clients.
May supervise direct reports in day to day support activities.

8 years of experience serving as an account administrator in a specific area of expertise to include trust administration

Job Title: while escalating issues to the CSC Manager. In addition
URL (URL of the job posting): the CSC Lead is responsible for reviewing work of junior team members to ensure appropriate quality is delivered.

Bank Name: Position Competencies

Successful incumbents have the ability to represent the team perspective on various projects; adapts quickly to a changing work environment; is skilled in learning new processes while assisting with implementation across the CSC team; possesses a strong knowledge of accounting procedures and principles and exhibits independent decision-making skills; possesses a strong ability to assess procedures and recommend process improvements.
Responsibilities:
Workload/Training & Quality Support

Job Title: and Relationship Managers.

Job Title: and practices are adhered to and escalates inconsistencies to CSC Manager.

Bank Name: RECAP Preparation

Reporting

Monitors financial covenant tracking system to ensure accurate and timely compliance monitoring.
Ensures that proper identification and placement of all financial documents has been made by CSC team members into the Electronic Credit file.
Other Duties
Strives to meet or exceed Service Level Agreements and communicates to CSC manager when not feasible.
Other duties as requested by CSC Manager.

The Commercial Underwriting Officer is responsible for the underwriting and documentation of larger and/or more complex loan requests for assigned Lines of Business (LOBs)
Job Title: owns deal analyses and executes workflow according to established Service Level Agreements (SLAs). Also assists in the on-going monitoring of the credit exposure for assigned relationships

Bank Name: Reporting Information:The Commercial Underwriter Officer reports to the Manager Commercial Underwriting (MCU).
Position Competencies:Successful incumbents possess strong analytical
Position Responsibilities:
1. Provide complete analysis of loan package for new deals

Prepares collateral charts
Job Title: risk ratings and other attachments.

Recommends appropriate controls and covenant structure for new credit requests.
Recommends risk rating.
2. Administration

Calculates loan covenants and assist with tracking on complex transactions in conjunction with CSC (Credit Support Center) team for assigned relationships. Follows-up with PM/RM on violations and provide recommendation for waiver
Shares responsibility with Credit Specialists for performing OFAC checks and identifying issues.
Serves as mentor and assists with training more junior underwriters and rotating credit analysts.
Investigates title searches

Adheres to department procedures for workload management.
Strives to meet or exceed SLA
Job Title: communicate to MCU and RM/PM.

Bank Name: Ensures appropriate RECAP formats/attachments are used in accordance with approved process & procedures and assists MCU with reviewing RECAPs.
Recommends process improvements in support if continuous improvement culture within Commercial Underwriting.
Other duties as assigned.
